Help text from NOO:
Select this option where you wish to apply as the Registered individual or a Nominated individual.

The nominated individual is responsible for matters relating to the application for registration and subsequent registration on the Early Years Register. They must be part of the registered person's governing body and must oversee (either alone or jointly with others) the management of the early years provision. The nominated individual should not be the manager of a setting unless that manager is also a member of the governing body.

sections.title: Are you disqualified from providing childcare for any reason listed in the criteria for disqualification under the Childcare Act 2006? (I1)

fields.label: Are you disqualified from providing childcare for any reason listed in the criteria for disqualification under the Childcare Act 2006? (I1)
fields.helpText: The criteria for disqualification are listed in Section 75 of the Childcare Act 2006.

fields.label: What are the criteria for disqualification?
fields.infoText:
The criteria are:
- having committed certain sexual or violent offences against a child or adult 
- being included on the list of those who are barred from working with children, held by the Independent Safeguarding Authority
- having been charged with certain offences against an adult, or an offence that is related to an offence, and had a relevant order imposed
- having been made the subject of a disqualifying order
- having been made the subject of an order or determination where a child has been removed from their care or been prevented from living with them
- having been refused registration as a childcare provider or have had a registration cancelled 
- living on the same premises as another individual who is disqualified for one of the above reasons.

This is a summary. The full list is set out in [Section 75 of the Childcare Act 2006](www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2006/21/section/75) (link does not open in a new window or tab).
Ofsted will use the details you provide in this section to assess whether you are suitable to provide childcare or be in contact with children.

sections.title: Do you have any criminal convictions or cautions? (I3)

fields.label: Do you have any criminal convictions or cautions? (I3)
fields.helpText: You must tell us about all instances, including any spent or unspent convictions or cautions.

fields.label: Are there any convictions or cautions I do not have to declare?
fields.infoText:
No, you must tell us about all instances, even if:

- it happened a long time ago
- you were a juvenile
- you did not receive a custodial sentence

This includes anything you accepted voluntarily. 

The Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 that allows some offences to be treated as 'spent' does not apply in this context.

comments.text:
The progressive reveal text was added to make the content more scannable/ easier to digest. As there are quite a few points for a user to take on board. 


(The grey help text doesn't allow for formatting such as bullet points, but the progressive reveal does.) 


Oftsed's BA told us that Ofsted get a high volume of users with non valid certificates. So hopefully the extra check step here will help reduce this.

fields.label: Have you subscribed to the DBS Update Service? (I5e)
fields.helpText: The Update Service is an online subscription service that lets you keep your DBS certificates up to date without having to reapply each time you need a new one.
optionHelpText: We recommend that you subscribe to the Update Service to keep your DBS certificate up-to-date. Details will be provided after you have submitted this registration.

sections.title: You must have a valid DBS certificate to continue with this form

fields.infoText:
By law, Ofsted must check your DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) details to assess your suitability for working or being in contact with children.

You'll need to save your progress, exit this form and come back later when you have a valid DBS certificate.
 You can apply for this through the [Ofsted DBS Application website](http://ofsteddbsapplication.co.uk/step-one.aspx).

fields.infoText:
###I confirm  that all the information I have given in this form is true to the best of my knowledge and belief.

###I understand and accept that Ofsted will:

fields.label: Declaration Information
fields.infoText:
- carry out checks and use information from the checks and this application to make a decision about my suitability to work with or be in regular contact with children 

-  share any information they obtain about me with other organisations where the law requires or permits them to, including where information raises concerns of a child protection nature

- share information about my application with inspection service providers who, under law, are permitted to carry out regulatory processes on behalf of Ofsted

- recheck my status with the DBS Update Service on a regular basis in order to assess my continued suitability to work with or be in close contact with children

fields.label: What checks will Ofsted carry out?
fields.infoText:
Ofsted carry out a series of checks to assess your suitability to work with or be in regular contact with children. As part of the checks we ask other authorities and people to share information they hold about you, with us. 

It may be necessary to repeat these checks from time to time in order to assess your ongoing suitability. 

You'll find more information about the checks we carry out in the 'Early Years and Childcare Registration Handbook' on GOV.UK. 

To view this:

1. Open a new window or tab.
2. Go to GOV.UK
3. Search for, 'Early Years and Childcare Registration Handbook'.

comments.text:
Policy/legal will need to validate all of this text (including the text in the progressive reveal) as we have updated it in parts to adapt it for the Gform as detailed below.


Adjusted wording in point 1 as it didn't mention what the information would be used for (which is needed GDPR wise). Also changed 'consent form' to 'application'. **Check with Ofsted, if this is accurate?

**We Removed the point on the NOO form that says: 
-" my application is not complete until I have paid the application fee."
Ask policy/SME whether the 'application fees'' point applies for this form? BA thought it doesn't. If it does apply this will need to be added back in.

Also, should point 4 on the declaration text be be re-worded to account for the fact that not all users are subscribed to the DBS Update Service?

In the original form it also includes the following text, within the help text: 
'I understand that if I give false information it may affect the application to provide childcare or the registration of the childcare provider.'
We have removed this for now, but should this be re-inserted into this page (if so it seems like it should be included in the  declaration page, rather than in the help text?)

The original NOO form also says: 
'By signing this form I confirm that I have read all the above statements.' We have replaced this with 'Confirm that you understand and accept that Ofsted will:'

The original NOO form also asks for 'signature' and pre-fills date of birth. So a decision will need to be made as to whether the gForm mirrors this on this form (and others?).

In the original NOO form it says:
'The checks we carry out are listed in the Early Years and Childcare Registration Handbook.' It is quite hard to find this information in the handbook. Do we need to summarise the checks here (if all of them haven't been flagged already in the form journey)?

Also might the information on GOV.UK in the  'Suitability Checks' guidance, be useful to point users to for more details (although it doesn't include criminal history, or employments checks etc)?

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/childminders-and-childcare-providers-register-with-ofsted/suitability-checks
comments.author: lizzerjones

comments.text:
*We have changed the help text so this will also need checking. The original help text for this section is as follows:


This section seeks your consent to carry out a series of checks to establish your suitability to work with or be in regular contact with children. 


As part of the checks we ask other authorities/people to share with us information that they hold about you. Ofsted uses the information from checks and any interviews to make a decision about your suitability to work with or be in regular contact with children. It may be necessary to repeat these checks from time to time in order to assess your ongoing suitability. The checks we carry out are listed in the Early Years and Childcare Registration Handbook.

By signing the form you give your consent to these checks. Without your consent and signature, we will not be able to process your application. This form must be signed by the individual named at questions C2 and C3.

If you give false information on the form it may affect the application to provide childcare or the registration of the childcare provider.

fields.label: Payment
fields.infoText:
Ofsted will assess your application, carry out relevant checks and contact you if we have any questions or need more information. 

 We will then contact you to let you know whether your application to  has been approved.
###Childminder assistants
If you want to work as a childminder assistant, we will send you a suitability letter once we have finished our checks. You cannot work unsupervised as an assistant until you have this letter.
###Keeping your DBS certificate up to date

If you have not subscribed to the [DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) 
Update Service](https://www.gov.uk/dbs-update-service),  Ofsted recommend that you do so to keep your DBS certificate up to date.

The Update Service needs to receive your application to subscribe within 28 days of your current DBS certificate's issue date.

We will also contact you to let you know whether your application to register has been approved. You must not start the role you are applying to register for, until you have received this.

comments.text:
NOTES FOR WHOLE FORM:
Form name

The name of the form will need further consideration once the scope of it has been confirmed, and once Mac and the team have decided whether to use the term 'daycare' for domestic childcare. Also when we know how much context a user will already have when they get to the form.

Our initial suggestion was:

Apply to register if you are connected with an Ofsted-registered childcare or daycare provider (EY2)


However some providers may not have registered yet (and be in the process of doing so). Therefore something like the following may work better: 


Apply to register as someone connected with a daycare or childcare provider (EY2)


The BA has flagged up that users are not technically registering, rather they are  - 'applying to be associated'. However the term associated may not be as clear/ plain English as connected?

Other notes

The following also need doing once the form content is finalised:


Acknowledgement page text (this may need to mirror some of the confirmation email content (which Mac is working) - as this often details what happens next/what a user needs to do next. It will also need to be informed by what acknowledgement page content from other Ofsted forms.


Error messages


Shortnames

H1 and field label match - check all done.


Check that info text is used rather than description text (as description text is not read by screen readers).

Validate all content with Ofsted

Check whether GDPR info (about how information will be used by Ofsted needs to be on every page - or just sections?

Make sure all radio buttons are stacked vertically


Would be good to double check that no help text from the NOO form hasn't been missed (as was tricky in places to make all content appear).
comments.author: lizzerjones
